content.description: Interesting climbing with sidepulls and some blocky features.
content.location: This is the first route at the top of the ramp leading up from the mossy garden.

content.description:
Blocky climbing up a too short pitch.

Angular features on dark gray rock.
content.location:
Located under the Via Ferrata area.

Left of One Rainy Wish.

content.description:
Fun climbing up nifty limestone features.

Start behind a pine tree, move up lower angle rock to just a bit left, then up and back right when below the shallow pillar feature.

Climb up just right of the blunt arête.
content.protection: 4 or 5 lead bolts to a set of horizontally placed single ring anchors.
content.location: Under the Via Ferrata area.  Just right of Soft Serve.

content.description: Amazing 5.9 slab climbing on good edges and pockets. Don't get distracted by the incredible view!
content.location: Last route on the right of the wall, just as the ledge widens to an open area looking out over the valley. Belay from the last bolt of the Via Ferrata.

content.description:
Super fun route with nicely spaced and improbable pockets up high, and a fun, steep rail edge and good feet features down low.

Have the belayer anchor in, then, step up past the fixed line in steep gray orange limestone just left of a dark, black streak.  Sweet gray limestone finish on polished rock which is surprisingly climbable at the grade.

Smiles all around after this one!
content.protection: Bolted sports route (8 to 10 lead bolts to bolted anchor).  An anchor sling prudent for the exposed belay.
content.location: Near the end of the via ferrata, just left of Little Dark Cloud.
